topic.name: Acting & Stagecraft
topic.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Acting & Stagecraft in Fine Arts

objectives.objective_text: Identify the beginning, middle, and end of a play.
Identify happy, sad, and angry faces.
Name what the character wants (e.g., the cookie).
Identify the antagonist.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Identify good and bad choices by characters.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Name the hero and the villain.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the 'Conflict'.
Identify when it is 'my turn' to speak.
Name the characters in the script.
Identify the climax of the story.
Identify the difference between a whisper, a talk, and a shout.
Recall that characters have feelings.
Observe how characters change in a story.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that stories teach us lessons.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that truth wins in the end.
Listen to the partner.
Listen for a specific word.
Recall where the scene takes place.
Observe stage directions (enter, exit).
Interpret the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA) basics.
Move like an animal (heavy elephant vs. light mouse).
Freeze like a statue.
Show feelings without using words.
Summarize how posture tells a story about a person.
Explain pantomime (acting with imaginary objects).
Walk across the stage as an old person vs. a young child.
Mirror a partner's movements.
Explain the concept of 'blocking'.
Defend the theology of the body as an instrument.
Pretend to be someone else.
Summarize the character's 'Super Objective' (what they want most).
Explain the 'Magic If' (What would I do if I were them?).
Explain the character arc (change over time).
Defend the empathy required to portray a 'villain'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the moral of the play.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why we shouldn't act out bad things just for fun.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the responsibility of the actor to the audience.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the portrayal of brokenness to highlight grace.
Play 'Let's Pretend' games.
Say 'Yes' to a friend's idea in a game.
Act out a scene without a script.
Summarize the 'Yes, And...' rule.
Explain why listening is more important than talking.
Accept an 'offer' from a scene partner.
Explain 'Blocking' (denying) an offer.
Defend the value of failure and risk-taking in art.
Repeat a line after the teacher.
Memorize a short rhyme.
Summarize strategies for memorization (repetition, writing it out).
Explain what a 'Cue' is.
Learn a 4-line poem by heart.
Recover quickly if a mistake is made.
Explain the 'Italian Run' (speed-through).
Defend the discipline of being 'off-book' early.
Summarize the plot of a scene.
Explain 'Blocking' (where actors move).
Mark the script for pauses.
Explain pacing and tempo.
Defend an interpretive choice based on textual evidence.
Speak clearly so others can understand.
Use the mouth to shape vowel sounds (A, E, I, O, U).
Recite a nursery rhyme with a big voice.
Summarize how to breathe from the diaphragm to support the voice.
Explain the difference between projection and yelling.
Practice tongue twisters for articulation.
Vary volume to match the character's distance.
Explain how to prevent vocal strain.
Defend the importance of diction in communicating truth.
Analyze Laban Movement Analysis (basics of weight/time/space).
Analyze the structure of a scene (Beginning, Middle, End) in improv.
Interpret the 'center' of a character (head-led, heart-led).
Connect physical tension to emotional stakes.
Analyze the text for clues about the character.
Interpret the Obstacle standing in the way of the Objective.
Connect tactics (verbs) to achieving the goal.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Compare a redemptive story with a hopeless one.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze Philippians 4:8 as a grid for art.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the difference between depicting sin and celebrating sin.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Connect storytelling to the Great Story (Redemption).
Interpret status transactions (High status vs. Low status).
Connect spontaneity to trusting the team.
Analyze the rhythm of the dialogue to aid memory.
Interpret the logic of the conversation.
Connect movement (muscle memory) to the text.
Analyze the script into 'Beats' (shifts in action).
Interpret Subtext (what is meant vs. what is said).
Connect given circumstances to performance choices.
Analyze the effect of posture on vocal resonance.
Connect consonants to clarity and vowels to emotion.
Evaluate the effectiveness of non-verbal communication.
Evaluate the difference between Method acting and technical acting.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the worldview inherent in a specific script.
Evaluate the narrative coherence of a long-form improv.
Evaluate the difference between knowing the words and knowing the meaning.
Evaluate the structural integrity of a play.
Evaluate the use of pitch, pace, and pause in rhetoric.
Create a simple backstory.
Construct a physical score for a character.
Synthesize psychological realism with physical embodiment.
Construct a detailed character profile using Uta Hagen's questions.
Synthesize internal motivation with external action.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Construct an argument for the Christian engagement with secular theater.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Ethics of Storytelling (Christian discernment in drama)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize artistic liberty with moral responsibility.
Create a short scene from a suggestion.
Construct a devised theater piece through improvisation.
Synthesize listening skills and quick thinking.
Construct a memorization schedule for a major role.
Synthesize textual fidelity with emotional freedom.
Construct a director's prompt book with detailed analysis.
Synthesize historical context with script analysis.
Construct a vocal warm-up routine for a specific performance.
Synthesize dialect work with character credibility.
